definition: texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: That is actually quite a rationalistic claim.
sentences.chinese: 这其实是一种理性主义的观点。

sentences.english: The rationalist finally will be of dogmatic temper in his affirmations .
sentences.chinese: 最后，理性主义者在断言时总带些武断性的气质。

sentences.english: Rationalistic tradition had been from Ancient Greek in western philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 理性主义传统在西方可谓源远流长。

sentences.english: Non-rationalism highlights id, which easily leads to the emergence of the hedonist culture.
sentences.chinese: 非理性主义突出本我，容易造成享乐主义文化的出现。

sentences.english: He prepared the ground for the secular, rationalistic version of modern natural law.
sentences.chinese: 他为现代自然法世俗的，理性主义的观点奠定了基础。

sentences.english: Rationalists had much to say about knowledge and how one might gain certainty.
sentences.chinese: 理性主义有很多要说的知识和如何可能获得确定性。

sentences.english: rationalists believe the markets will come up with their own mechanisms for managing risk.
sentences.chinese: 理性主义者相信市场会为他们自己的风险管理机制了。

sentences.english: The western classical tragical conception showed the restrictions of rationalism to tragical spirit.
sentences.chinese: 西方古典悲剧观念体现了理性主义对悲剧精神的制约。

sentences.english: The great divide which separates rationalism from superstition.
sentences.chinese: 把理性主义与迷信相区别的分水岭。

sentences.english: One such self- confident rationalist was Thomas Jefferson.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯杰弗逊就是这样一个自信的理性主义者。

sentences.english: The answer, of course, is it is the rationalists who are irrational.
sentences.chinese: 当然，问题的答案在于正是这些理性主义者才不理性。

sentences.english: Belief in feeling, instinct, or other nonrational forces rather than reason.
sentences.chinese: 非理性主义对情感，本能，或其它非理性力量的信仰。

sentences.english: It is a classic sanctuary in which the rationalist fancy may take refuge .
sentences.chinese: 这是一所古雅的圣殿，理性主义者可以躲在其中。

sentences.english: The I Ching, to the embarrassment of rationalists , often gives excellent advice.
sentences.chinese: 易经对于理性主义者的困惑而言，经常提优秀建议。

sentences.english: Rationalists are Descartes, Leibniz and Spinoza.
sentences.chinese: 理性主义者有笛卡尔，莱布尼兹和斯宾诺莎。

sentences.english: Rationalism basically rejects instincts, which leads to abnormal development of culture.
sentences.chinese: 理性主义基本排斥本能，导致文化的畸形发展。

definition: epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
deism, theological theory of God who does not interfere in the Universe
